
Cinnamon fans her wings.

You follow Slep'infir'a through an open old black obsidian gate...

[Ari'kian Keep Grounds.]

Stepping stones cut across what was once a large lawn. Their destination is the rather imposing manse to the north. Weeds have choked out any grass that may have at one time existed. A cold breeze drifts across the area, even the most stoic can feel the goose bumps rising on their arms.  An open old black obsidian gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Slep'infir'a north...

[Ari'kian Keep Grounds.]

Grey stepping stones, worn with time, bisect the overgrowth of weeds. They give you access to the untended flower beds that front the mansion. Waist high weeds crowd out what visible path remains. Your best bet seems to be to aim for the front door or the gate to the south.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* south* northwest*.

You follow Slep'infir'a north...

[Ari'kian Keep Grounds.]

A large marble staircase leads to the porch of a beautiful keep. Grey stepping stones stretch both directions across the front of the home, taking you past overgrown tangled vines, and sickly sweet smelling hibiscus.  Some black marble stairs are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Slep'infir'a through some black marble stairs...

[Ari'kian Keep Porch.]

Worn boards of the porch creek against your weight. Two massive obsidian front doors stand before you. A tarnished brass knocker, in the shape of a demon head, glares down. The porch extends across the front of the Keep, and at one time must have been a nice place to watch both the sunrise and sunset.  Some open massive black obsidian double doors and some black marble stairs are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Slep'infir'a through some open massive black obsidian double doors...

[Ari'kian Keep.]

Entering the foyer the first thing you notice is its subtle opulence. The floor is highly polished black marble, the walls are covered with a gold stripped, cream colored paper. Light filters in through a large paned glass window which, at one time must have glistened, but is now coated with the accumulation of years of dirt. A finely crafted staircase, its balustrade polished from many years of use, rises to the second floor unsupported.  A polished oak circular staircase and some open massive black obsidian double doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious exits: east* northwest*.
You see Cinnamon retreat 1 UDs to the rear!

You follow Slep'infir'a through a polished oak circular staircase...

[Second Floor, Ari'kian Keep.]

This long dark hall stretches the length of the keep. Highly polished wooden floors are covered with a long black hallway runner. Gold papered walls are punctuated with creamy white flecks. Small crystal sconces dot the walls at various intervals, their candles melted down to useless stubs.  A polished oak staircase and a polished oak circular staircase are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Slep'infir'a through a polished oak staircase...

[Third Floor, Ari'kian Keep.]

The small landing of the third floor is elegantly decorated. Even time and dust have not ravished the understated opulence. A large crystal chandelier hangs from the ceiling, its teardrop crystals tinkling from the breeze entrance. A black velvet settee reclines against the wall below beautiful lead-paned windows framed with gold and black velvet drapes.  A polished oak staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Slep'infir'a north...

[Third Floor, Ari'kian Keep.]

A beautiful black marble floor, accentuated by gold marbling throughout, continues to glisten through the light layer of dust that resides upon it. Against the gold papered walls stand two rather large smoke stained torcheries that have not been used for many years. A large black obsidian door graces the eastern wall.  An open large obsidian door is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Slep'infir'a north...

[Third Floor, Ari'kian Keep.]

Heading off the main hallway is a smaller, less elaborate, branch. The marble flooring continues both directions, but it is plain to see that while no expense was spared in the main hallway, the small western hallway is stark in comparison. Two gold brocade chairs rest against the eastern wall, a small oak table sits between them. Bumping up against either chair will get you a mouthful of choking dust.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

Cinnamon hums.

You follow Slep'infir'a west...

[Third Floor, Ari'kian Keep.]

In this smaller hallway the black marble floor continues on. The walls having never been finished are made of stone block. A slight chill pervades this portion of the hallway. Two doors stand face to face on both the northern and southern walls. They are made of a simple pine, and not finished.  An open pine door and a broken pine door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Slep'infir'a through an open pine door...

[Servant's Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

A rather large and ornate bed dominates this room. Its beautiful red velvet coverlet and plush feather ticking seem very out of place in this austere servant's quarters. The only other furniture in this room is a small pine table with a cracked bowl and dusty pitcher upon it. An old faded tapestry covered with nymphs frolicking in a flowered pasture hangs on the wall.  An open simple pine door is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: None.

You follow Slep'infir'a through an open simple pine door...

[Third Floor, Ari'kian Keep.]

In this smaller hallway the black marble floor continues on. The walls having never been finished are made of stone block. A slight chill pervades this portion of the hallway. Two doors stand face to face on both the northern and southern walls. They are made of a simple pine, and not finished.  An open pine door and a broken pine door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Slep'infir'a through a broken pine door...

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Stark white, unfinished walls line this hallway. A smooth carpet, worn over time and faded with age, lies on the floor. Several small, dirt caked windows line the barren wall. Through them you can see an abundant growth of vines snaking their way up the side of the tower.  A broken pine door is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: west*.

You follow Slep'infir'a west...

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

The plain hallway comes to an abrupt halt at a rather imposing cobblestone wall. The curvature of its face and the age of the stones date it to well before the building of this small hallway. Set within the cobblestones is a large door, that blends so well it is hardly discernible to the naked eye.  A closed large cobblestone door is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: east*.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

The putrid odors of sweat, urine, and blood confront your sense of smell, threatening to overwhelm it, and each of your other senses. Cedar heartwood planks comprise the floor of the tower. [Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A large velvet tapestry adorns the nearby wall. Though the plush material is torn and tattered in many places, the image of a regal looking San Elf can be made out. His visage is one of cruelty and sadness, despair and benevolence, typical of Sanene royalty.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A finely crafted cedar bookshelf spans the width of the far tower wall. The red, knotted wood matches the warped floor planks at your feet, though it is in much better condition. A few worn tomes adorn the shelves like the last leaves of an autumn blood oak.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A small onyx table stands propped against the cobblestone tower wall. Crimson wax remnants of a pillar candle adhere to the glinting midnight tabletop. Another red wax candle stands next to its worn partner, ready for the life and death that it receives from fire.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

The charred remains of a cherry wood cabinet stand in the dim light. Multicolored shards of glass line the doors and litter the base of the wooden display case. Undisturbed within are many different instruments of pain and torture: long pins, barbed needles, jagged slivers of bluesteel, studded flails, spiked collars, and coils of finely-linked moonsilver.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Small knobs adorn the wall on either side of the circular staircase. Upon further inspection, these knobs are actually small ebony hands, palms up and fingers slightly curved into a grasping position. The minute appendages line the walls high and low, some still holding long iron pokers and malleable steel paddles, others serving as hooks for three-pronged barbed whips.  A cold spiraling stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A green veined marble chair occupies the center position in this portion of the tower. The armrests contain thick leather straps, obviously designed for holding the occupant of the chair in place securely, and sharp spikes where the wrists would rest. [Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Concentric circles of fire-blackened stone form an eerie pattern on the floor beneath a suspended platform. The platform, hanging haphazardly by pulleys from only two of its four corners, is crafted from loose sheets of ring mail. Each ring is large enough to allow your finger to pass through, as well as the searing heat of the fire. The ring mail still holds strands of hair and rotting scales.  A cold stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

This tower floor is subdivided into many cramped cells. Opposite the larger cells, small three-foot cages are stacked on top of each other, their locks long since rusted away. [Ari'kian Keep, Tower]

Bluesteel beams form the infrastructure of the conical roof in this top floor prison room. The criss-crossing network of beams high above serves as the anchor point for a dozen swaying manacle chains. Unlike the rest of the tower, the inward sloped floor in the prison is comprised of uneven cobblestone. A large grate sits like a waiting maw in the center of the floor, ready to consume any fluid that comes its way.   A cold stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st chain-rattling executioner and the 1st spectral sanene inquisitor.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: None.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Concentric circles of fire-blackened stone form an eerie pattern on the floor beneath a suspended platform. The platform, hanging haphazardly by pulleys from only two of its four corners, is crafted from loose sheets of ring mail. Each ring is large enough to allow your finger to pass through, as well as the searing heat of the fire. The ring mail still holds strands of hair and rotting scales.  A cold stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: east* southeast*.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A rusted mess of iron chains lay sprawled across the floor. The cold, black iron that once held helpless prisoners taut in place has given way to brittle, burnt orange links. A large rodent skitters across he warped floor, its yellow eyes never leaving yours.  A short iron frying pan, an iron morningstar, a platinum cutlass, a short iron frying pan, a cotton tunic, a lyre, a short iron frying pan, an open worn sack, and an open small black leather instrument case are here.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A green veined marble chair occupies the center position in this portion of the tower. The armrests contain thick leather straps, obviously designed for holding the occupant of the chair in place securely, and sharp spikes where the wrists would rest. Similar restraints are found where the legs would be, and a larger leather binding hangs where a head would be positioned. Directly under the armrests hang rusted copper buckets.  A cold spiraling stone staircase is here.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Concentric circles of fire-blackened stone form an eerie pattern on the floor beneath a suspended platform. The platform, hanging haphazardly by pulleys from only two of its four corners, is crafted from loose sheets of ring mail. Each ring is large enough to allow your finger to pass through, as well as the searing heat of the fire. The ring mail still holds strands of hair and rotting scales.  A cold stone staircase is here.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A green veined marble chair occupies the center position in this portion of the tower. The armrests contain thick leather straps, obviously designed for holding the occupant of the chair in place securely, and sharp spikes where the wrists would rest. Similar restraints are found where the legs would be, and a larger leather binding hangs where a head would be positioned. Directly under the armrests hang rusted copper buckets.  A cold spiraling stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Small knobs adorn the wall on either side of the circular staircase. Upon further inspection, these knobs are actually small ebony hands, palms up and fingers slightly curved into a grasping position. The minute appendages line the walls high and low, some still holding long iron pokers and malleable steel paddles, others serving as hooks for three-pronged barbed whips.  A cold spiraling stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: southeast* southwest*.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Small knobs adorn the wall on either side of the circular staircase. Upon further inspection, these knobs are actually small ebony hands, palms up and fingers slightly curved into a grasping position. The minute appendages line the walls high and low, some still holding long iron pokers and malleable steel paddles, others serving as hooks for three-pronged barbed whips.  A cold spiraling stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: southeast* southwest*.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

The charred remains of a cherry wood cabinet stand in the dim light. Multicolored shards of glass line the doors and litter the base of the wooden display case. Undisturbed within are many different instruments of pain and torture: long pins, barbed needles, jagged slivers of bluesteel, studded flails, spiked collars, and coils of finely-linked moonsilver.   A short iron frying pan, a short iron frying pan, a cotton tunic, and a cotton tunic are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A green veined marble chair occupies the center position in this portion of the tower. The armrests contain thick leather straps, obviously designed for holding the occupant of the chair in place securely, and sharp spikes where the wrists would rest. Similar restraints are found where the legs would be, and a larger leather binding hangs where a head would be positioned. Directly under the armrests hang rusted copper buckets.  A cold spiraling stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Concentric circles of fire-blackened stone form an eerie pattern on the floor beneath a suspended platform. The platform, hanging haphazardly by pulleys from only two of its four corners, is crafted from loose sheets of ring mail. Each ring is large enough to allow your finger to pass through, as well as the searing heat of the fire. The ring mail still holds strands of hair and rotting scales.  A cold stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

This tower floor is subdivided into many cramped cells. Opposite the larger cells, small three-foot cages are stacked on top of each other, their locks long since rusted away. The cedar heartwood planks under the nearest cage door bear many deep scratch marks, a futile attempt to escape the prison.   A cold stone staircase is here.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Stepping inside one of the cramped cells offers a perspective few wish to retain. Black iron manacles, hanging from chains imbedded in the walls, clank against each other hauntingly. The heavy, metallic smell of blood permeates the cell. Any view that might had been offered by the window has been squelched by the boards nailed over it.

[Ari'kian Keep, Tower]

Bluesteel beams form the infrastructure of the conical roof in this top floor prison room. The criss-crossing network of beams high above serves as the anchor point for a dozen swaying manacle chains. Unlike the rest of the tower, the inward sloped floor in the prison is comprised of uneven cobblestone. A large grate sits like a waiting maw in the center of the floor, ready to consume any fluid that comes its way.   A cold stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Ari'kian Keep, Tower]

The floor stands agape here; a large hole resulting from the cedar floor boards being ripped up. Not far from the destruction is a collection of newly constructed heartwood coffins, their outer hulls inscribed with arcane and runic symbols. The closest container sits slightly ajar, offering the curious explorer a look within...   A cold stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st spectral sanene inquisitor and the 2nd spectral sanene inquisitor.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: southeast* southwest*.

A green veined marble chair occupies the center position in this portion of the tower. The armrests contain thick leather straps, obviously designed for holding the occupant of the chair in place securely, and sharp spikes where the wrists would rest. Similar restraints are found where the legs would be, and a larger leather binding hangs where a head would be positioned. Directly under the armrests hang rusted copper buckets. [Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A rusted mess of iron chains lay sprawled across the floor. The cold, black iron that once held helpless prisoners taut in place has given way to brittle, burnt orange links. A large rodent skitters across he warped floor, its yellow eyes never leaving yours.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Small knobs adorn the wall on either side of the circular staircase. Upon further inspection, these knobs are actually small ebony hands, palms up and fingers slightly curved into a grasping position. The minute appendages line the walls high and low, some still holding long iron pokers and malleable steel paddles, others serving as hooks for three-pronged barbed whips.  A cold spiraling stone staircase is here.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Small knobs adorn the wall on either side of the circular staircase. Upon further inspection, these knobs are actually small ebony hands, palms up and fingers slightly curved into a grasping position. The minute appendages line the walls high and low, some still holding long iron pokers and malleable steel paddles, others serving as hooks for three-pronged barbed whips.  A cold spiraling stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A green veined marble chair occupies the center position in this portion of the tower. The armrests contain thick leather straps, obviously designed for holding the occupant of the chair in place securely, and sharp spikes where the wrists would rest. Similar restraints are found where the legs would be, and a larger leather binding hangs where a head would be positioned. Directly under the armrests hang rusted copper buckets.  A cold spiraling stone staircase, a short iron frying pan, some crooked glass spectacles, and a worn ragdoll are here.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A green veined marble chair occupies the center position in this portion of the tower. The armrests contain thick leather straps, obviously designed for holding the occupant of the chair in place securely, and sharp spikes where the wrists would rest. Similar restraints are found where the legs would be, and a larger leather binding hangs where a head would be positioned. Directly under the armrests hang rusted copper buckets.  A cold spiraling stone staircase, a short iron frying pan, some crooked glass spectacles, a worn ragdoll, a short iron frying pan, a short iron frying pan, a closed titanium box, and an open enchanting leather bag are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Concentric circles of fire-blackened stone form an eerie pattern on the floor beneath a suspended platform. The platform, hanging haphazardly by pulleys from only two of its four corners, is crafted from loose sheets of ring mail. Each ring is large enough to allow your finger to pass through, as well as the searing heat of the fire. The ring mail still holds strands of hair and rotting scales. [Ari'kian Keep, Tower]

Bluesteel beams form the infrastructure of the conical roof in this top floor prison room. [Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Concentric circles of fire-blackened stone form an eerie pattern on the floor beneath a suspended platform. The platform, hanging haphazardly by pulleys from only two of its four corners, is crafted from loose sheets of ring mail. Each ring is large enough to allow your finger to pass through, as well as the searing heat of the fire. The ring mail still holds strands of hair and rotting scales.  A cold stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: east* southeast*.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

This tower floor is subdivided into many cramped cells. Opposite the larger cells, small three-foot cages are stacked on top of each other, their locks long since rusted away. The cedar heartwood planks under the nearest cage door bear many deep scratch marks, a futile attempt to escape the prison.   A cold stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Stepping inside one of the cramped cells offers a perspective few wish to retain. Black iron manacles, hanging from chains imbedded in the walls, clank against each other hauntingly. The heavy, metallic smell of blood permeates the cell. Any view that might had been offered by the window has been squelched by the boards nailed over it. [Ari'kian Keep, Tower]

Bluesteel beams form the infrastructure of the conical roof in this top floor prison room. The criss-crossing network of beams high above serves as the anchor point for a dozen swaying manacle chains. Unlike the rest of the tower, the inward sloped floor in the prison is comprised of uneven cobblestone. A large grate sits like a waiting maw in the center of the floor, ready to consume any fluid that comes its way.   A cold stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

This tower floor is subdivided into many cramped cells. Opposite the larger cells, small three-foot cages are stacked on top of each other, their locks long since rusted away. The cedar heartwood planks under the nearest cage door bear many deep scratch marks, a futile attempt to escape the prison.   A cold stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Concentric circles of fire-blackened stone form an eerie pattern on the floor beneath a suspended platform. The platform, hanging haphazardly by pulleys from only two of its four corners, is crafted from loose sheets of ring mail. Each ring is large enough to allow your finger to pass through, as well as the searing heat of the fire. The ring mail still holds strands of hair and rotting scales.  A cold stone staircase is here.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Stepping inside one of the cramped cells offers a perspective few wish to retain. Black iron manacles, hanging from chains imbedded in the walls, clank against each other hauntingly. The heavy, metallic smell of blood permeates the cell. Any view that might had been offered by the window has been squelched by the boards nailed over it.   A button eyed sock puppet, an empty small silver shot glass, some broken iron manacles, some broken iron manacles, a wooden broom, a bloody bone tooth, a small silver shot glass, and an open enchanting buckskin pouch are here.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

A green veined marble chair occupies the center position in this portion of the tower. The armrests contain thick leather straps, obviously designed for holding the occupant of the chair in place securely, and sharp spikes where the wrists would rest. Similar restraints are found where the legs would be, and a larger leather binding hangs where a head would be positioned. Directly under the armrests hang rusted copper buckets.  A cold spiraling stone staircase is here.

[Tower, Ari'kian Keep.]

Small knobs adorn the wall on either side of the circular staircase. Upon further inspection, these knobs are actually small ebony hands, palms up and fingers slightly curved into a grasping position. The minute appendages line the walls high and low, some still holding long iron pokers and malleable steel paddles, others serving as hooks for three-pronged barbed whips.  A cold spiraling stone staircase is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing violet crystal heart), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon.
Obvious paths: southeast* southwest*.

[Tarath Bends.]

The stark terrain is impressive in its scope and austerity. One cannot help but feel insignificant and temporary amid the expanse of granite and limestone formed through the millennia. [Tarath Bends.]

Only the hardiest of life forms hold their own on the rocky steppes. Small cascades of icy water stream down the boulders and darken their surfaces. Tough lichen and scrub pines absorb nutrients from the mineral laden run-off. The sun shines brightly on the southern exposure of the trail, sheltered from the wind and freezing cold. Bright green oases of life sprout from rocky niches and the path is slippery where the green slimy growths cross it.

[Tarath Bends.]

A carpet of needles covers the path. Pine cones, larger then a Thugian fist, dot the ground. Enormous trees collide with large boulders blocking you from venturing too deep into the overgrown wood. [Tarath Bends.]

A massive rent opens up between the mountain side heading south. Boulders sit precariously on the mountain side ready to fall to the ground. Many tons of earth have shifted from the face of the mountain to the ground, covering the small growth of forest at its base. The southeastern road is totally blocked with rubble.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above you), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon (flying 10 feet above you).

[Tarath Bends.]

Old trees lay side by side with the massive boulders of the mountain, intermingling in a terrible landslide. The mountain top has broken off and slid across the eastern road stopping all forms of transportation. It would take years for mortal hands to remove the tons of stone from the original roadway to make it passable once again. Thankfully, nature has changed the landscape for the better, and has opened a gap through the mountain to the north.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above you), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* southwest*.

[Tarath Bends.]

If not for the well maintained road, you'd be lost in the gently sloping meadow covered in tall grasses.  The grass is so tall, in fact, that it comes nearly to your shoulder.  The effect of the breeze through the grass is of a rippling golden sea.

[Northern Crossing.]

An osprey soars above the raging Silver River, scanning the water for a meal. Suddenly, it dives down to the surface and snatches a rather large trout from the water. The trout wriggles helplessly in the large birds grip as it is carried off on the western horizon.

[Spur Gateway.]

Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. Their lack of interest shows that anyone approaching has already been observed from above for some time. A grate in the ground loosens mud from wagon wheels and hooves before they pass through the gate, helping to keep the streets of Spur fairly clean. [Gateway.]

The relative safety inside Spur is a comfort to those returning from the fields and mountains. To those leaving, a massive wall of defense around the city lies ahead. Archer towers beside the gate overlook the wall, offering a painful welcome to would-be invaders. Several guards on foot patrol pass and disappear behind a thick, bluesteel banded steelwood door. [Trade Way.]

[Trade Way.]

Deep grey mists surround a strange pile of rubble that lies south of the road. Occasionally a priest clad in a simple grey robe will wander past the rubble and whisper a short prayer under his breath. The fence running around the rubble is well kept, but the gate which once allowed entrance to this Temple has been chained closed.  A grey iron chained gate, a pile of rubble, and a street lantern are here.

[Trade Way.]

The throngs of travelers thicken as one heads east along Trade Way. An Anthian plays softly on a strange looking stringed instrument, her melodic voice filling the air. [Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. [Bazaar Path.]

Many people crowd the narrow Bazaar Path, either heading towards the infamous Bazaar, or forcing their way back towards Trade Way. For a small price, a farmer can rent a booth and directly market his goods. Both some of the best and some of the worst deals can be made within this collection of stalls. The tall wall of Spur looms high to the east, and many of the guards take an early peek into the carts and the goods coming to market.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above you), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon (flying 10 feet above you).

You follow Castin north...

[Bazaar Path.]

Further passage along Bazaar Path is blocked occasionally by brawling peasants. Fights break out over who got here first, who gets to sell first, whose goods are better and who should just pack up and leave. When guards are forced to leave their posts to settle the arguments, all involved lose.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above you), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon (flying 10 feet above you).

You follow Castin north...

[Bazaar Path.]

The muffled noises you hear drifting in from the west come out of the Bazaar itself, a veritable hive of activity day and night. An occasion exotic smell is carried by the breeze to tantalize the nose. A large etched window displays tastefully dressed mannequins of many races.  An open sturdy mahogany door and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Bazaar Path.]

The going slows down briefly as someone stops dead in their tracks. Every so often one feels the need to take in the sounds and smells that are uniquely the Bazaar. Any slow down in the movement of the crowd creates a loud string of curses. The sellers are eager to get to market to get rid of their goods, and the buyers anticipate their purchases.  A street lantern is here.

[Bazaar Path.]

[Bazaar Path.]

Deep, muddy ruts mar the road. A trickle of water flows from an unknown source creating a horrid hazard. Drivers curse one another for holding up the flow of traffic. Merchants and buyers carefully pick their way around the hold up, attempting to carefully navigate the slippery ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Bazaar Path.]

The foot traffic on Bazaar Path turns south down a small trail into the heart of the Bazaar. Many of the smaller carts follow the buyers and merchants to avoid the conflicts with the larger wagons that continue west. The shouting up ahead quickens the pulse of even the most experienced seller.  A street lantern is here.

[The Bazaar.]

The bottleneck of carts, merchants and buyers block any exit out of the Bazaar to the north. While it is easy to travel with traffic, trying to move against it is impossible. Those who drive the large wagons that navigate these small streets shout curses and vile threats at each other, hoping it creates a break in traffic and allows them to move forward to their destination.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above you), Castin the Anthian, and Slep'infir'a the Dragon (flying 10 feet above you).

You follow Castin south...

[The Bazaar.]

Other than the odd customer passing en route to another shop, nobody pauses before this empty stall. Stalls such as these are rented out to the locals for their personal use. Bits of refuse from food sold to the south litter the ground.  This stall is becoming someone's personal trash dump.

This area is illuminated.

[Food Way.]

At this intersection many stands display their exotic foodstuffs. Hanging from large hooks are various unidentifiable hunks of meat, and vegetables of all shapes and colors. The only thing more prevalent than the merchants and buyers are the bugs, who clamor to find the most pungent item to land on. To the northeast a small tent can barely be seen hiding behind the stalls.  A white silk tent and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Castin south...

[The Bazaar.]

Moving into the heart of the Bazaar, you encounter a more established shop. The building is sturdier, and built for long term occupancy. The general store has a steady stream of customers, and it serves those young adventurers who are in need of supplies.  A weathered wooden sign, an open faded chestnut door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[The Bazaar.]

Guards stand before each stall at this intersection, on what has come to be known as Jeweler's Row. Crowds of customers vie for the finest stones and most beautiful gems. All different manner of merchants hawk their wares as those you should buy. Those who are not careful are just as liable to walk away with a sparkly piece of glass as an expensive diamond.  A bright vellum sign, an open stall, and a street lantern are here.

[The Bazaar.]

The well-defined Bazaar path heads off to the west. This corner is a mix of the old and the new. On one corner an old stall is barely standing. The roof has caved in, and it quickly becomes apparent that this location has become a local dump. Pieces of wood that look suspiciously like some of the leftovers from other construction sites are piled on top of rotting offal. On the opposite corner a new tent is being erected, its high roof and vivid coloring pleasing to the eye.  An open stall and a street lantern are here.

[Locksmith.]

A heavy odor of unwashed sweaty bodies assails you as you enter this rickety establishment. A short Go-blin-al scurries around in the shadows behind the counter. [Bazaar Path.]

[Bazaar Path.]

[Bazaar Path.]

[Side Street.]

A new building has been erected on this side street. It is sturdily constructed from wood and brick, and bears a sign reading, "Symher's Trading Post." Various objects line the window display ranging from weapons and armor to random objects you've never seen before. Insistent bartering goes on at all hours.  A pair of open double applewood doors and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian, and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious exits: east*.

You follow Castin east...

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian, and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Castin south...

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian, and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Castin through an archway...

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Minnie the Secian, Cinnamon the Noble Secian, and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Market Circle.]

An arch between two large buildings connects Market Circle and Market Street. The more reputable shopkeepers do business within the circle, but pay higher taxes for the privilege. The buildings have been built to last, as these merchants are no traveling tinkers. Interlocking stone walkways and colorful plantings span this central area. Despite the number of animals waiting outside the bank for their owners, the area is spotless. Loud chatter in many languages can be heard from the southwest.  A marble archway, an open elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, and a wooden sign are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Market Street.]

Market Street ends here at a large archway. People bustle in and out of the arch, some without so much as a nod. The city wall rises up to the south and west of the buildings of Market Circle. A small sign is posted on the wall beside the archway.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north*.

[Market Street.]

Situated between the well-traveled Trade Way to the north and the fine shops of Market Circle to the south, this small stretch of road is busy at all times of day. Adventurers with sacks of plundered goods leave Market Street and head west. A shrewd businessman has set up shop in this busy area of the Market District.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* south* west*.

You follow Castin north...

[Trade & Market.]

The buildings of Market Circle stand to the south. It becomes obvious that the area through the arch is a much cleaner marketplace than the bazaar. An inviting eatery stands beside the road, its door open to those weary after a long trip to Spur, as well as those preparing to venture to the great expanses beyond the west gate. A human couple exit the building, arm in arm. A small sign stands beside the intersection.  A sign, an open glossy lacquered oak door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east* south* west*.

You follow Castin east...

[Trade Way.]

This well-worn road separates the Bazaar to the north and Market Circle to the south. Only a Thugian could appreciate the layered odors of simmering foodstuffs and shoppers from the Bazaar. Crowds of people push past, some brushing against you. It might be a good idea to keep an eye on your coinpurse.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Castin east...

[Trade & Bazaar.]

A path to the north winds its way among various stalls and tents. Some specialty outlets can be found, provided one does not get lost in this maze known as the Bazaar. More permanent structures to the south suggest finer goods as well as increased security.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* east* west*.

You follow Castin east...

[Trade Way.]

Many townsfolk pass along this busy thoroughfare. Rich and poor alike mix freely on this street, much to the dismay of a passing nobleman. A young human struggles with an armful of packages and two young children in tow. Those in need of goods or supplies head west towards the market, those looking for the news of the day head east towards Town Square.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Castin east...

[Trade Way.]

A large gate separates the Merchant District and Town Square-the hub of Spur's activity. The partially opened gate is currently able to accommodate the simultaneous passage of several locals and visitors, but can be expanded to accept carriages, or sealed to ward against invasion.  Guards stand sentry from atop the wall as well as the ground.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: west*.

You follow Castin through an open stone gate...

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchant Walk comes to an abrupt end at a massive moonsilver gate. The towering walls of Spur on either side of the gates force all to pass by the guards who are constantly on the watch for thieves and bandits. Just beyond the gates one can glimpse the bustling Merchant District of Spur.  A gilded oak sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east*.

You follow Castin east...

[Merchant Walk.]

Several city guardsmen have just finished wrestling to the ground some young tough thieves, who thought to rob one of the returning merchants. To one side a relieved-looking Fir Elf gentleman holds on tightly to his gold-tipped walking stick, as the human boy yells his innocence to any who might listen. His pleas fall on deaf ears as the guards drag him away.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Castin east...

[Merchant Walk.]

Merchants, some in frilly finery, others dressed in homespun wools, travel back and forth along this street on their way to and from work. They seem to blend together here, if only briefly. Several of the more haughty looking merchants are trailed by overloaded carts pushed along by haggard young apprentices.   A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st flerian mime.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Castin east...

[Merchant Walk.]

A neatly kept park fronts this portion of Merchant Walk. Topiary and low shrubberies partition off small sections of the park. Young lovers sit on benches almost hidden from view, gazing at each other with looks of love, oblivious to the continual bustle of passing customers and merchants on their way to do business.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Castin east...

[Merchant Walk.]

Neatly trimmed shrubbery line well-maintained cobblestones along Merchant Walk. Apprentices rush by carrying supplies and orders, carrying out their masters' business. Several wooden benches line the walk for those customers who need to rest from the strain of carrying heavy parcels.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious exits: east* west*.

You follow Castin east...

[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.

You follow Castin southeast...

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

You follow Castin south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st townsman and the 2nd townsman.
In the room is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious exits: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.

You follow Castin south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Castin through an open iron gate...

[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A gilded silver plaque and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. The cobblestones of the road are smooth and even. The attention to detail shown here is a dramatic change from some of the other parts of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* southwest*.

You follow Castin southwest...

[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: northeast* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  An elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* southeast*.

You follow Castin southeast...

[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.

You follow Castin southeast...

[Intersection.]

The avenue comes to a fork, with Noble Way curving from south to the northwest. A side-street heading off to the east leads to an extremely well kept neighborhood that easily surpasses everything around it in splendor and magnificence. Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

The entire avenue is composed of fine cobblestone, each level with its neighbor, providing a smooth ride for passing carriages and horses. The stones were customized by craftsmen, cut to order, rather than simply placed wherever they might fit. A few stately oaks and elms line the sides of the road, shading travelers during the daylight hours.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

Numerous trees lining the avenue serve as the dividing border between the majestic estates of the nobility and the lightly traveled roadway. The estates themselves are noticeably closer to the avenue than those to the south. However, they are no easier to access, still protected by their own guarding walls, some covered with ivy or colorful blooming vines.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

Occasional gates and driveways lead back into the well-kept estates of the city's nobility, breaking and adding interest to the defining plane of the walls lining Noble Way. The rest of the street seems to mimic the splendor of the estates beyond the wall. Swept and trimmed, the roadway exudes a simple, yet beautiful elegance.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Crossroads.]

A small roadway bordered by flowering hedges bisects the wide avenue of Noble Way at a right angle, heading east to west.  A thick, sturdy sign stands just off to the side of a charming path, its large friendly letters intent on luring travelers into the city's premiere roadstay, the Gilded Lion Inn. The entrance is clearly marked and welcoming, extending off to the southeast.  A wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* west*.

You follow Castin west...

[Park Road.]

An exotic blend of shrubs and bushes glorify both sides of this short avenue. Starting at only a few feet tall, they slowly gain in height as they line the road to the west, reaching well over man-height at the distant archway that marks the entrance to Spur Park. To the side of the road is an open small gate. It has the look of a private residence.  An open small iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Castin west...

[Park Gate.]

A small path begins under the broad archway leading into the park, and winds peacefully through a beautiful variety of trees, shrubs and flowers. A sweet fragrance fills the area, hinting at the existence of some rare flowering plant nearby. The arch itself is covered with ivy and moss and shows signs of gradual decay from long exposure to the weather.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east*.

You follow Castin through an archway...

[Spur Park.]

You gaze out over a rolling expanse of lushly groomed grass. City gardeners work diligently in the distance, pruning and raking the various beds and plantings. The surroundings are peaceful as only a slight breeze stirs the branches above. The faint scratching sound of the rakes is barely audible. An archway leads back out of the park.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: southwest* northwest*.

You follow Castin southwest...

[Spur Park.]

A curved wooden bridge has been built over this inlet of the ornamental pond. The bridge provides access to the rest of the park as well as a good vantage to enjoy the view. A quick glance down into the water reveals the flash of a shimmering, rainbow-hued fish darting nervously out of sight.  A flowing Go-blin-al cherub statue is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Castin southwest...

[Spur Park.]

Standing proudly in the center of this clearing is a statue of the current Governor. The existing statue is replaced by that of the new as each governor takes office. This one has not yet suffered the debilitating effects of wind and weather. Meticulously groomed grass surrounds the monument as well as a few recent plantings that have yet to take hold.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast* southwest* northwest*.

You follow Castin southwest...

[Spur Park.]

This short, circular path curves back upon itself after passing through charming woodland. The gardeners often spend their mornings here, grooming the lush flora so that people can end their day with a quiet stroll along the path, a high point for many residents.  A path is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: northeast*.

You follow Castin through a path...

[A Living Forest]

The woods sings with life as birds and insects vie for your ear melding in a pleasing song. The dark green trees with their shaggy bark almost seem to breathe, their presence is so felt. Bright light filters through the trees.  A giant cherry tree and a path are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Castin north...

[A Living Forest]

As you travel further into the forest, its cool dampness caresses your skin. Rustling of the leaves and an occasional snapping twig accompany the singing birds. Somewhere nearby water bubbles.  A giant cherry tree is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin north...

[A Living Forest]

The thickening overhead canopy blocks most of the light except where a few shafts pierce the gloom. The path becomes more difficult to follow and the forest ahead looms darker still.  A giant oak tree and some brown oak leaves are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Narrow Shaft]

A narrow cavern, forming a rock hallway stretches before you. A closer look at the walls reveals a multicolored crust of striated crystals. This whole cave might have been created by the flow of trapped water through the stone over thousands of years. The insidious sound of dripping water is muffled in the narrow space.

This room is illuminated.
In the room is Castin the Anthian.
Obvious exits: north* south*.

[Crystal Cavern]

A strangely curved room, the ceiling slopes downward to meet the floor making it difficult to stand upright. Beautiful crystals cluster on every surface and hang from the low rock ceiling. Some larger formations span floor to ceiling in darkly gleaming columns. The facets reflect any available light making them take on a life of their own.  A shimmering dark crystal formation is here.

This room is illuminated.

Castin looks like a 5'0" standard adolescent light boned, muscular bodied Anthian Forester.
He has long, wild, wispy platinum blonde hair, with reddish brown eyes, and looks translucent.
He appears to be calculating right now.
He bears the mark of Elindale.
He can be attacked by other players.

On his back is a pair of blazing burnt sienna wings that blend into ivory white tips.

He appears to be in perfect health.

Physical appearance:

He looks happy in the cool water

                        Visible Equipment
A leather white bone backsheath                    (on back)
A moon shaped ivory talisman                       (around neck)
A bright emerald ring                              (ring (right))

He has been bestowed the following title(s):
  Noble of the Realm

[Spur Park.]

This short, circular path curves back upon itself after passing through charming woodland. The gardeners often spend their mornings here, grooming the lush flora so that people can end their day with a quiet stroll along the path, a high point for many residents.  A path is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast*.

You follow Castin northeast...

[Spur Park.]

Standing proudly in the center of this clearing is a statue of the current Governor. The existing statue is replaced by that of the new as each governor takes office. This one has not yet suffered the debilitating effects of wind and weather. Meticulously groomed grass surrounds the monument as well as a few recent plantings that have yet to take hold.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast* southwest* northwest*.

You follow Castin northeast...

[Spur Park.]

A curved wooden bridge has been built over this inlet of the ornamental pond. The bridge provides access to the rest of the park as well as a good vantage to enjoy the view. A quick glance down into the water reveals the flash of a shimmering, rainbow-hued fish darting nervously out of sight.  A flowing Go-blin-al cherub statue is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Castin northeast...

[Spur Park.]

You gaze out over a rolling expanse of lushly groomed grass. City gardeners work diligently in the distance, pruning and raking the various beds and plantings. The surroundings are peaceful as only a slight breeze stirs the branches above. The faint scratching sound of the rakes is barely audible. An archway leads back out of the park.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southwest* northwest*.

[Park Gate.]

A small path begins under the broad archway leading into the park, and winds peacefully through a beautiful variety of trees, shrubs and flowers. A sweet fragrance fills the area, hinting at the existence of some rare flowering plant nearby. The arch itself is covered with ivy and moss and shows signs of gradual decay from long exposure to the weather.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east*.

[Park Road.]

An exotic blend of shrubs and bushes glorify both sides of this short avenue. Starting at only a few feet tall, they slowly gain in height as they line the road to the west, reaching well over man-height at the distant archway that marks the entrance to Spur Park. To the side of the road is an open small gate. It has the look of a private residence.  An open small iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian (flying 10 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Castin east...

[Noble Crossroads.]

A small roadway bordered by flowering hedges bisects the wide avenue of Noble Way at a right angle, heading east to west.  A thick, sturdy sign stands just off to the side of a charming path, its large friendly letters intent on luring travelers into the city's premiere roadstay, the Gilded Lion Inn. The entrance is clearly marked and welcoming, extending off to the southeast.  A wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Noble Way.]

Occasional gates and driveways lead back into the well-kept estates of the city's nobility, breaking and adding interest to the defining plane of the walls lining Noble Way. The rest of the street seems to mimic the splendor of the estates beyond the wall. Swept and trimmed, the roadway exudes a simple, yet beautiful elegance.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

Numerous trees lining the avenue serve as the dividing border between the majestic estates of the nobility and the lightly traveled roadway. The estates themselves are noticeably closer to the avenue than those to the south. However, they are no easier to access, still protected by their own guarding walls, some covered with ivy or colorful blooming vines.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

The entire avenue is composed of fine cobblestone, each level with its neighbor, providing a smooth ride for passing carriages and horses. The stones were customized by craftsmen, cut to order, rather than simply placed wherever they might fit. A few stately oaks and elms line the sides of the road, shading travelers during the daylight hours.  A street lantern is here.

[Intersection.]

Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  An elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

[Noble Way.]

[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack and a street lantern are here.

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. [Town Square Center.]

A massive gate dominates the center of Town Square. Monolithic stone imperial dragons stand to each side of the gate like sentinels keeping watch over the city of Spur. Beneath the colossal structure rests a large flowing marble fountain. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a shimmering blue pool. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each one a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A carved marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a brightly painted wooden birdhouse, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, and a flowing white marble fountain are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Town Square North.]

The traffic on the northern street heading away from town square is an eclectic bunch.  Those who belong to the guilds to the north travel in packs on their way to and from guild events.  It is not unusual to see a group of armored fighters passing a group of robed clerics, each heading in the opposite direction. The large temple of Rinanni rises to the north, its white marble almost glowing in the light.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* southwest* west*.

You follow Castin southwest...

[Town Square West.]

People carrying bundles stream in from the west and rapidly lose themselves in the large crowds moving about in the vast town square. Several citizens head west with bulging coinpurses babbling excitedly about what they're going to purchase. Giggling children dart around the slower moving folks rushing on their way to spend the silvers in their pockets.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* west*.

>
You follow Castin southeast...

[Town Square South.]

The outward appearance of the people here seems a bit classier. Rich clothing and large coin purses are prevalent amongst the travelers. In fact, many of the folk heading into Town Square from the south are accompanied by large bodyguards to assure their safety. The well maintained road is lined with small brass lanterns, each swinging off an individual pole. No expense has been spared to keep those who travel this road safe from the hoodlums that relish the darkness.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* south* west* northwest*.

You follow Castin northeast...

[Town Square East.]

Travel to the eastern portion of Town Square finds battle clad warriors shoulder to shoulder with chained criminals and those who live outside the Spurian Walls. The cobblestones that line the street are stained with blood.  It is unknown as to whether the blood is from guards carrying out quick executions, or gladiators who refused to wait their turn for arena space.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* east* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Castin west...

[Town Square Center.]

A massive gate dominates the center of Town Square. Monolithic stone imperial dragons stand to each side of the gate like sentinels keeping watch over the city of Spur. Beneath the colossal structure rests a large flowing marble fountain. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a shimmering blue pool. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each one a celebrated hero of Spur's past.  A carved marble statue of a Human, a carved marble statue of a Dragon, a brightly painted wooden birdhouse, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, and a flowing white marble fountain are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Micron the Noble Draco, Kavita the Noble Secian, Beebay the Thugian, Methoss the Drag-al, Korlit the Drag-al, Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you), Nyoko the Noble Drake, Aurak the Monitanian, and Layana the Secian (flying 30 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast* south* southwest* west* northwest*.

[Town Square.]

The elegant Hotel Royale towers above the street, its emerald door sparkling in the light. The patrons that stroll in and out are catered to, doors opened and closed for them, and baggage and packages carried by harried servants. The large Bank of Spur sits on the east side of the square. Its location close to the Royale is not a coincidence. A gold-trimmed door is proof of the success of this branch of the Spurian bank and those who run it.  An elegant gold-trimmed walnut door, open emerald steel door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
