[Southern Avenue.]

Smooth stones make up the street that leads from the center of Spur to the south. Each stone has been carefully fitted for the most comfortable travel by both cart and traveler alike. A well dressed Guard patrols the area in his dress uniform. Captains don't allow for slovenly appearances on this patrol.  A street lantern is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious exits: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Southern Avenue leads between the center of Spur and the homes of the prosperous and wealthy. Several of the Ladies of the city stroll along the avenue chatting about the current events and latest gossip of the Spur. Behind them, harried servants carry their reticules and all those belongings that they cannot be without.  A street lantern is here.

[Southern Avenue.]

Vast estates tower over the huge Spurian wall towards the south. The well-to-do who live in these homes idle away their days, enjoying the luxury of time. Standing next to a very empty lantern pole, a small Flerian child insists in a plaintive wail, that he had nothing to do with the missing lantern. The well-dressed guard that interrogates him keeps pointing at a small sack on the ground and its obvious contents.  An open small burlap sack and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Southern Avenue & Gorey Street.]

The boughs of a large apple tree hang over the well tended avenue. Below the beautiful tree stands a small fountain. Atop the fountain is an intricately carved Secian who appears to be dancing with the water as it splashes around her. Set in the marble base is a small plaque that reads, "For those who have gone before us." Many stand for a moment as they pass this way, giving thanks for the gift of life that is given by both the apple tree and the Secians of long ago. Large piles of dirt and broken stone lay on either side of the street as workmen ready the east and west alleys for expansion.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.

You follow Castin south...

[Southern Avenue.]

Standing next to the large iron gate that separates the center of town from those of the elite class are several of the Spurian Guard. They are here to assist all who pass with the simple kindness of opening a gate, or the more important task of escorting those in need to the bank or market. A young looking cadet rubs wax into the stones of the city wall, his task is daunting, but one that will teach him discipline.  An open iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north*.

[Gateway.]

An elegant, carved wooden sign hangs above the ornate gateway set into the massive wall that divides Spurs Noble District from the Town Square. You can make out city guardsmen peering down attentively at all that approach from their posts atop the imposing wall. They seem to take a greater interest in this part of town, though there does not seem to be anything threatening enough here to warrant such attention.  A gilded silver plaque and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: south*.

[Noble Way.]

To the north, you can make out an ornately scrolled gateway set in the base of the imposing city wall. The refined roadway of Noble Way stretches out to the south. The cobblestones of the road are smooth and even. The attention to detail shown here is a dramatic change from some of the other parts of the city.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

An unusually large home, even for this part of town, lies off to the west. It seems as if one ambitious owner is slowly buying up the lots next to his and adding them to his own. Groundskeepers are at work in the surrounding gardens, trimming and raking, so intent on their work they do not bother to acknowledge the passing traffic on the road.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* southwest*.

You follow Castin southwest...

[Noble Way.]

Many grand, even ostentatious, homes line this stretch of Noble Way. Most of the residents here were fortunate enough to be born into the right families. Few that live in this area have ever actually had to work for a living. Glancing at the nameplates reveals many of the recognizable names of the Spur. Some of these names could almost be considered famous.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: northeast* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

Noble Way continues to wind its way among the rather modestly sized, but elegant, homes of the Spur's successful. Many a peasant farmer may live in homes larger than these, but none can match the quality found here. A peaceful, luxurious feeling pervades this part of town; perhaps it is the drifting floral scents wafting from the well-tended gardens.  An elegant black iron gate and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

Gazing down each of the nearby private drives reveals a glimpse of a luxurious home, each a miniature estate in its own right. Short, stout walls and manicured hedges serve to keep out the riffraff and to protect the small, expensive gardens. Every detail has been attended to display the exotic plants, in all their pampered perfection.  A street lantern and a closed rosewood door are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* southeast*.

You follow Castin southeast...

[Noble Way.]

Leaving the exceptionally wealthy estates of the Spurian nobility, Noble Way heads toward the Town Square to the northwest. Along the roadside can be seen the in-city homes of successful merchants and other wealthy citizens of the Spur. The homes display a slightly different style, perhaps they are not quite so restrained; a touch more exuberance and freedom with materials is displayed.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest*.

You follow Castin southeast...

[Intersection.]

The avenue comes to a fork, with Noble Way curving from south to the northwest. A side-street heading off to the east leads to an extremely well kept neighborhood that easily surpasses everything around it in splendor and magnificence. Everything, even the carefully pruned trees and the manicured shrubbery displays a desire for elegant perfection.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* south* northwest*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

The entire avenue is composed of fine cobblestone, each level with its neighbor, providing a smooth ride for passing carriages and horses. The stones were customized by craftsmen, cut to order, rather than simply placed wherever they might fit. A few stately oaks and elms line the sides of the road, shading travelers during the daylight hours.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

Numerous trees lining the avenue serve as the dividing border between the majestic estates of the nobility and the lightly traveled roadway. The estates themselves are noticeably closer to the avenue than those to the south. However, they are no easier to access, still protected by their own guarding walls, some covered with ivy or colorful blooming vines.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

Occasional gates and driveways lead back into the well-kept estates of the city's nobility, breaking and adding interest to the defining plane of the walls lining Noble Way. The rest of the street seems to mimic the splendor of the estates beyond the wall. Swept and trimmed, the roadway exudes a simple, yet beautiful elegance.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Crossroads.]

A small roadway bordered by flowering hedges bisects the wide avenue of Noble Way at a right angle, heading east to west.  A thick, sturdy sign stands just off to the side of a charming path, its large friendly letters intent on luring travelers into the city's premiere roadstay, the Gilded Lion Inn. The entrance is clearly marked and welcoming, extending off to the southeast.  A wooden sign and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* east* southeast* south* west*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

Majestic elms continue to line this broad roadway, sheltering the avenue on both sides and further enhancing the grandiose atmosphere. Fronting the beautiful homes, cobbled paths edged with narrow flower beds meander through nearby private gardens. Though they appear wonderful places to spend an afternoon or take a picnic, the glances from those tending the estates makes it clear they are only for the invited.  A street lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Noble Way.]

The occasional locked gate marks the entrance to some of the more hidden estates of Spurs nobility. From this broad avenue, little can be seen of their splendor. Behind the imposing gate recedes a proud drive, disappearing mysteriously into the trees. If not for the large imposing tower rising above the hedges it would be hard to discern anything was beyond the gate. It is apparent the residents do not wish to be disturbed.  A street lantern, a closed morbius door, and an open black iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[South Gate.]

A well-guarded gateway separates the city's residential district from the farmlands just beyond. Guards carefully eye all that enter or exit the city, beckoning gruffly to random travelers for a closer inspection. The structure of the guards' barracks is visible above the road to the west. A weathered wooden sign is posted by the gate.  An open stone gate, a wooden sign, a closed thick stone door, and a street lantern are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious exits: north*.

You follow Castin through an open stone gate...

[South gate.]

Through the gate lies the city of Spur, the major center of trade and civilization on the plains. The dusty road leading through the gates is well traveled, and walls of the city are in good repair. A small shack sits to the west of the road, during most times of the day a dusty coach can be seen waiting in front, its horses stomping with impatience to be gone. To the right of the door is a small window, its opening covered with metal bars. An old man, missing most of his teeth, waits patiently for the travelers to pay their fare, and then directs them into the waiting area. On the east side of the road a billowing multicolored tent has been erected, the hustle and bustle of merchants and customers can be seen coming and going at all times of the day.  A rainbow silk tent and an open iron gate are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying 5 feet above you).
Obvious paths: east* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[East Trade Road.]

A wooden signpost gives the directions and distances to the two closest cities. The arrow leading west is denoted as Spur, while the one directing east states Caersech. [East Trade Road.]

A hedge of spiky brambles forms a natural division from the lands and the swampy terrain to the south. Tall, limbless trees dot the horizon there, their bases lost in the misty depths of the gases hovering over the waters. Now and then a strange, growling sound echos up to the north, or an odd, high-pitched call of some unseen crow, probably feasting on a fallen creature hidden in the mists. The path curves away from the sounds, as popular choice has preferred to travel around the edges, rather than through the marshy sludge.

This area is illuminated.

[East Trade Road.]

The open plains are becoming scattered with scraggly trees, the wood of which proving inefficient to use for building as the elements of nature have grown the trunks so twisted and hard in order to withstand the onslaughts of time. Circling around the northern base of a small hill, there lies the lapping edge of the swamp to the south. Small slimy creatures lie on the smooth stones near the water, darting into it at the speed of light as you near them with tiny splashes and echoing wakes blending into the small, gentle waves coming into the shore. Swarms of mosquitoes move along the land in unison, lending them the appearance of large, unified bodies hovering around for the next feast.

This area is illuminated.

[East Trade Road.]

Ravens dark as pitch spread their feathers to a wing-span of nearly four feet, so large they are, as they quarrel over an abandoned mule carcass on the roadside breaks out. How final death seems, so casually nature simply encompasses the bodies of the fallen, through carrion hunters or moldy decay. Yet through death there be life again, any number of these ravens being sustained through this death, so they may live. Perhaps only to become sustenance for one of the swamp creatures, who, in turn, spends its life continuing the cycle.

This area is illuminated.

Stepping near the orb to investigate closer only causes it to again blink out of existence, forming once more, deeper into the mists. It soon becomes apparent that the mysterious lights are attempting to slyly lead you into the swamp. To or for what purpose, is the question.

l in knot
The footbridge that once connected this path to its match on the other side of the overflowing rushing river is now nothing more then a few charred pilings. Tiny insects buzz around their remains, finding a comfortable new home. Lashed to the remains of one of the more sturdy pilings is a tall steel pole. Wrapped around the pole, and tied securely is a taut rope. Bobbing ever so lightly due to the strain of the riverboat, the rope holds tight.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, and some carved oak benches are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 5 feet above you) and Castin the Anthian (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: south*.

The footbridge that once connected this path to its match on the other side of the overflowing rushing river is now nothing more then a few charred pilings. Tiny insects buzz around their remains, finding a comfortable new home. Lashed to the remains of one of the more sturdy pilings is a tall steel pole. Wrapped around the pole, and tied securely is a taut rope. Bobbing ever so lightly due to the strain of the riverboat, the rope holds tight.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, and some carved oak benches are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Hollow Tree, Treehaven.]

Through the years this giant old oak has been home to many of the forest's creatures, each new inhabitant enlarging the living space bit by bit until it has become what it is today; a hollowed tree large enough to fit a drake, wings and all. Various remnants can be found among the bark chips scattered along the floor, a long bone emerging here, a scrap of thick blanket there.  A gnarled oak opening is here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.

[Riverboat.]

Lined with wooden seats, this slim oak boat looks to be able to carry its passengers relatively quickly to their destination. [Riverboat.]

Lined with wooden seats, this slim oak boat looks to be able to carry its passengers relatively quickly to their destination. A sturdy rope is threaded through a steel eyelet that rises about two feet above the bow of the boat. The captain's muscles strain with each heave-ho on the rope, as the boat cleaves through the deep waters of the river.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian and Castin the Anthian (seated).
Obvious paths: None.

[Riverside.]

Swollen beyond its banks, the once small creek is now a rushing overflowing river. What used to be the charred footbridge is now a safe haven for fish well down river, nothing left of its structure. Set well into the bank of the river is a long steel pole. Lashed to the pole is a heavy rope. The voice of the riverboat captain can be heard echoing across the water, taking command and moving his cargo.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, some carved oak benches, and a riverboat are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: southwest*.

>[Riverside.]

Swollen beyond its banks, the once small creek is now a rushing overflowing river. What used to be the charred footbridge is now a safe haven for fish well down river, nothing left of its structure. Set well into the bank of the river is a long steel pole. Lashed to the pole is a heavy rope. The voice of the riverboat captain can be heard echoing across the water, taking command and moving his cargo.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, some carved oak benches, and a riverboat are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: southwest*.
>
You follow Castin southwest...

[Bubbling forest stream.]

The path here turns due west, climbing the river bank towards taller evergreen trees. The river rumbles loudly, singing its ancient tune. North of the river, fir and cedar begin to dominate while the deciduous varieties fade.  Some fresh flowering sprouts are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: northeast* west*.

You follow Castin west...

[Forest Path.]

The path continues to the west through a mix of moss covered Fir and Alder trees. Looking toward the taller trees to the west, you realize that it's not the trees that are higher, it's the rising ground. For some reason, the hill makes you uneasy.  Some mossy Fir trees and some majestic Alder trees are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east* west*.

You follow Castin west...

[Forest Path.]

The path forks around the hill to the northwest and southwest. The hill definitely makes you uneasy, especially when you notice its unnatural regularity. The undergrowth is so thick it prevents you from climbing the hill.  A thick undergrowth is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east* southwest* northwest*.

You follow Castin southwest...

[Forest path.]

Somehow the rumbling river seems to have died out here into a calm steady stream. Much of the water looks to be disappearing into some sort of side cavern that runs beneath the side of the river bank.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: northeast* southwest*.

You follow Castin southwest...

[Bend in forest path.]

The path bends to the northwest and northeast here, skirting the foot of the hill. The stream bubbles along seemingly unaffected by the loathsome presence of the hill. Moss, lichen and ferns cover the ground, making for a soft bed, if you dared to sleep.  A clear mossy river and an ivy entwined wooden gazebo are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: northeast* northwest*.

You follow Castin northwest...

[Branch in forest path.]

The path branches again, finally leading away from the hill. Your feet and legs are getting damp as the wet ferns brush against your legs. The trees open up slightly here and you think it would be a nice place to rest, if it weren't for the hill.  Some lush ferns are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: southeast* southwest* northwest*.

You follow Castin southwest...

[Forest path.]

The path slopes down to the south here as it leads away from the hill.  The evergreens subside as the ground becomes moist due to the proximity of the stream. The undergrowth is quite thick here, and the music of the stream begins to pervade your senses.  A charming embankment is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: northeast* south*.

You follow Castin south...

[Forest stream.]

The path ends here as it comes upon the steep banks of a forest stream.  A wooden bridge, in surprisingly good repair, crosses the stream. The skeletal remains of some fish litter the stream bank and nosing about you notice some large pawprints.  A wooden bridge and some skeletal fish remains are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north*.

You follow Castin through a wooden bridge...

[Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. A number of small saplings dot the ground between the black trunks. Between the stream bank and oaks, a small path of four-leaf-clover shaped stones weave a windy path through the forest.  A stone bridge, a wooden bridge, a clump of wildgrass, and a small winding stone path are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: east*.

[Hidden Meadow]

The trail opens to a meadow filled with a riot of colorful wildflowers. Large orange and black butterflies and zipping bees fly from flower to flower, while red winged birds dive from the trees after the tiny buzzing insects that float over the ground. [Skout Pond.]

The mysterious blue rose bushes open up for you and you find it ends at the edge of a shimmering deep blue pond. Across the water stands an imposing elm tree which shades the far portion of the water. Overhead, the overflow water of the river gushes over a rocky embankment, crashing into the pond and creating a fine mist throughout the area. A charming sitting shelf has been ornately carved into the eastern portion of the pond and stunning roses crawl up the towering stone embankments to the east and west. Blue, pink and red rose petals scatter in the breeze, coming to rest on the ponds surface and an occasional trout can be seen darting back and forth.  A charming waterfall, a deep blue pond, a grey stone sitting shelf, and a narrow gap are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: None.

[Skout Pond.]

The mysterious blue rose bushes open up for you and you find it ends at the edge of a shimmering deep blue pond. Across the water stands an imposing elm tree which shades the far portion of the water. Overhead, the overflow water of the river gushes over a rocky embankment, crashing into the pond and creating a fine mist throughout the area. A charming sitting shelf has been ornately carved into the eastern portion of the pond and stunning roses crawl up the towering stone embankments to the east and west. Blue, pink and red rose petals scatter in the breeze, coming to rest on the ponds surface and an occasional trout can be seen darting back and forth.  A charming waterfall, a deep blue pond, a grey stone sitting shelf, and a narrow gap are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying 10 feet above ground) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: None.

[Hidden Meadow]

The trail opens to a meadow filled with a riot of colorful wildflowers. Large orange and black butterflies and zipping bees fly from flower to flower, while red winged birds dive from the trees after the tiny buzzing insects that float over the ground. [Hope's Path.]

A small path, its stones in the shape of four leaf clovers, winds its way through the sparse remains of a once dense undergrowth. Blackened limbs crunch underfoot beneath piles of moist, newly fallen leaves.  A small winding stone pathway is here.

This area is illuminated.

Obvious paths: north* southeast* southwest*.

You follow Castin southeast...

[Hope's Path.]

The path of four leaf clove shaped flagstones leads past a small clean shack and into a well formed tunnel through the thorn bushes to the east and the Caersech to the west. The small shack is set back from the road, its walls built of a whitewashed birch. A sturdy corral, filled with well-fed horses, stands to the left of the shack. A matched pair of dapple grays stand in front of the shack waiting to take their human baggage to their destination. To the left of the door, behind a small paned window, a beautiful Fir Elf female takes coin and in return, with a charming smile, directs those who have paid their fare into the waiting room.  A small shack, a freshly painted sign, a notice of non-refund, and a small winding stone pathway are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying beside you) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: northeast* east* southwest* northwest*.

You follow Castin east...

[Hope's Path.]

Contrasting starkly with the ashes of the forest and brush is a freshly constructed set of stairs that wraps itself about the large tree. The intricate woodwork that decorates the steps is of the finest quality, as if in parody to the blackened destruction of the hedges and brambles around the base of the trunk. Bright green leaves of clover have begun springing up through the ashy soil in conjunction with soft moss to lend a durable cushion to this well-traveled spot.  Some steps circling the tree, a freshly painted wooden sign, a healthy green patch of clover, a flowing marble fountain, and some clover shaped stones are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying beside you) and Castin the Anthian.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.

You follow Castin through some steps circling the tree...

[Steps.]

The latticework surrounding and covering the spiral staircase is finely crafted. The intertwining beams seem to weave a delicate pattern above you, accenting the view of the forest floor. The view of burned trees and the scorched structure of the fallen inn spoils the otherwise wondrous scene.  Some steps circling the tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st wooden golem.

[Steps.]

Two freshly carved regal elven warrior statues guard either side of this sturdy landing near the top of the impressive staircase. The silent sentinels stare out into the charred forest far below, grimly watching the destroyed landscape of blackened, skeletal trees.  Some steps circling the tree are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Lilioth the Secian (flying beside you) and Castin the Anthian.

[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, an open large straw basket, and a closed forest green Elindalian book of prayers are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Lilioth the Secian (flying beside you), Zaheela the Leuian, Castin the Anthian, and Anyah the Human (seated).
Obvious exits: None.

[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, an open large straw basket, and a closed forest green Elindalian book of prayers are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Zaheela the Leuian and Anyah the Human (seated).
Obvious exits: None.
>

Anyah nods firmly.

Anyah looks like a 5'9" standard young light boned, average bodied Human.
She is seated.
She has very long, curly, medium glossy black hair with red highlights, almond shaped bluish gray eyes, and looks neat.
She appears to be puzzled right now.
She bears the mark of Sa.
She can be attacked by other players.

On her right ankle is a tattoo of a red rose entwined around a flute.

She appears to be in perfect health.

Physical appearance:

Her long hair cascades in thick, long curls down her back and over her shoulders. Her eyes sparkle like sun glistening on a lake in mid afternoon. She smiles at you with pouty lips. A faint scent of roses follows her as she moves.

[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, an open large straw basket, a closed forest green Elindalian book of prayers, a quiver of birch arrows, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, and a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel are here.

>[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, an open large straw basket, a closed forest green Elindalian book of prayers, a quiver of birch arrows, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, and a brown potato are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Chip the Secian (seated), Myo the Noble Flerian Guide, Lilioth the Secian (seated), Zaheela the Leuian, Shaleu the Noble Leuian (seated), Hott the Noble Leuian (seated), Castin the Anthian, Marinda the Secian, and Anyah the Human (seated).
Obvious exits: None.

>[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, an open large straw basket, a closed forest green Elindalian book of prayers, a quiver of birch arrows, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, and a brown potato are here.

>[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, an open large straw basket, a closed forest green Elindalian book of prayers, a quiver of birch arrows, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, and a brown potato are here.

[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, an open large straw basket, a closed forest green Elindalian book of prayers, a quiver of birch arrows, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, and a brown potato are here.

list to any
You listen intently to Anyah.
>
The vulture spreads its wings.

Zaheela listens intently to Anyah.

Anyah says, "Once upon a time there lived a not-so-fair maiden named Bella. She was big boned, had long buck teeth, freckles that covered almost her entire body.."

Anyah says, "Her nose was too large, her eyes too small, and the fact that she has one eyebrow also didn't help"

Anyah says, "In a town where outer beauty meant fame, fortune, and happiness, Bella was downright depressed."

Anyah says, "On a scale of one to ten, of course, ten being the prettiest girl in town, Bella ranked a big, fat zero"

Anyah says, "But Bella had an inner beauty. She was kind hearted, and always had a smile for people. Even if the smile scared half the folk in town."

Anyah holds the open opal encrusted moonsilver compact close and smiles sweetly into it, frowning as the mirror cracks.

Anyah says, "One sunny afternoon, Bella was sitting alone next to a small pond, staring into it. Feeling sorry for herself"

Anyah says, "As she was moping, one of the town boys came up to her. In fact, the very boy she had a very large crush on. She gazed at him with her small beady eyes, her uni-brow arched high on her flat forehead."

Anyah says, "The boy smirked at her."

Anyah smirks towards the audience.

Anyah says, "And said..."

Anyah smirks and taunts the crowd.

Anyah exclaims, "Ugly Bella, Ugly Bella! Never ever gonna catch a fella!"

Anyah says, "Bella started to cry and quickly rose to her feet. She began to run. In no general direction. Just away."

Anyah says, "After some time, it became apparent that she was totally, utterly lost, somewhere in the woods."

Anyah says, "Bella threw herself onto the ground..."

Anyah says, "And begin to cry.."

Anyah lies down and begins to sob pathetically, snorting a few times as she does.

Anyah exclaims, "From out behind a tree crept a little, odd shaped man. Bella screamed!"

Anyah screams, "AAAAA!"

Anyah says, "The dwarf jumped backwards, nearly falling over a twig and exclaimed.."

Anyah exclaims, "Don't do that! My heart!"

Anyah flails her arms about wildly and grasps her chest.

Anyah says, "The dwarf sat next to her on the ground, asked her why she was crying."

Anyah says, "Through her tears and snorts, Bella told him what had happened."
You see Fenwhelt take a bite of his fresh roasted jugged hare.

The raven pecks loose a few ruffled feathers.

Anyah says, "The dwarf looked at her with kindness in his beady little eyes and said,"

Anyah exclaims, "Wha do dey know! You is gorgeous! Come, I be fixin' dinner, an' company be jus' fine!"
You see Fenwhelt take a bite of his fresh roasted jugged hare.

Anyah says, "Bella stood up and followed the dwarf to his little cottage, snuggled deep into the forest woods."

Anyah says, "Throughout the meal, they shared stories, they laughed, they cried about their injustices."

Anyah says, "And at the end of the meal, Bella yawned and curled up into a small chair next to a hearth."

The vulture spreads its wings.

Anyah blinks her eyes closed and snores.

Anyah says, "In the morning, she found herself resting peacefully in the dwarfs bed. The dwarf lie on the floor below her, and she had nearly stepped on him getting up."

The vulture glares.
You see Fenwhelt take a bite of his fresh roasted jugged hare.

The vulture glares.

Zaheela says, "Never the less, Elindale only knows why, the two of them were very close, if not the best of friends."

Zaheela says, "One day the two friends were thinking of a way to catch some poor bug for dinner. Inks quick mind was working as fast as a spiders can, and Stride... well, he was complaining his little lungs out from his tunnel."

The vulture spreads its wings.

Shleegulz gasps while cover his mouth not meaning to interrupt, and glances around apologetically.

Shaleu grins.

Julien's stomach growls.

Zaheela asks, ""huh?" Stride stared at Ink, who merely smiled and repeated, "A game as well as our way to get dinner. I bet you that I can catch more flies then you could." Ink said, pointing at the nearby fly swarm nearby."

Zaheela exclaims, " "Your on!" replied Stride, drooling at the sight of so many flies."

Zaheela says, "A minute later, Stride set off towards the rear of the swarm of flies. Finding a convenient place to hide, he sat and waited till a group of young flies had approached."

The raven glares.

The raven cleans itself with its beak.

Zaheela exclaims, ""Psst!" he whispered. The flies swiveled their heads, one little fly cleaning his antennae, only to be thawped by his elders. "Over here!" The flies, wary yet stupid, inched over to the hiding Stride."

Zaheela says, "After getting a rather large bunch, he whiped away his drool and began to rant about life and how it basically it stunk to be a insect.."

The raven spreads its wings.

Zaheela says, "He kept on ranting for a hour or so, driving off many of his listeners with pure boredom."

[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, an open large straw basket, a closed forest green Elindalian book of prayers, a quiver of birch arrows, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, and a brown potato are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st vulture (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Marinda the Secian (seated), Fenwhelt the Anthian (seated), Pollii the Secian (seated), Zaheela the Leuian (seated, a raven upon her left shoulder), Shaleu the Noble Leuian (seated), Julien the Leuian (seated), Lauranna the Noble Fir Elf (seated), Castin the Anthian, Anyah the Human (seated), and Shleegulz the Go-blin-al (seated, a vulture upon his left shoulder).
Obvious exits: None.

[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, an open large straw basket, a closed forest green Elindalian book of prayers, a quiver of birch arrows, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, and a brown potato are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st vulture (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Marinda the Secian (seated), Pollii the Secian (seated), Zaheela the Leuian (seated, a raven upon her left shoulder), Wilomena the Noble Human (seated), Shaleu the Noble Leuian (seated), Julien the Leuian (seated), Lauranna the Noble Fir Elf (seated), Castin the Anthian (seated), Anyah the Human (seated), and Shleegulz the Go-blin-al (seated, a vulture upon his left shoulder).
Obvious exits: None.

[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, an open large straw basket, a closed forest green Elindalian book of prayers, a quiver of birch arrows, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a brown potato, and an empty warm mug of Muldavian coffee are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st vulture (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st husky (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st black kitten (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Lilyth the Noble Secian (seated), Marinda the Secian (seated), Tigerlily the Anthian (seated), Pollii the Secian (seated), Zaheela the Leuian (seated, a raven upon her left shoulder), Wilomena the Noble Human (seated), Shaleu the Noble Leuian (seated), Julien the Leuian, Castin the Anthian (seated), Anyah the Human (seated), and Shleegulz the Go-blin-al (seated, a vulture upon his left shoulder).
Obvious exits: None.

Wilomena says, "I don't know a lot o ye.  Firstly.."

Shleegulz listens intently to Wilomena.

The raven lets out a streak of loud screeching caws.

Shaleu smiles softly.

Shleegulz says to Wilomena, "hi I'mz Shleegulz"

Wilomena says to Shaleu, "I'd like ta apologize fer bargin in and causin a fuss when ye were givin yer story."

Wilomena grunts.

Shleegulz waves at Wilomena.

Wilomena shrieks.

Wilomena points at Shleegulz.

The vulture screeches loudly.

Wilomena exclaims, "I meant him!"

Wilomena flails her arms about wildly.

Shleegulz blinks.

Shleegulz asks Wilomena, "jhoo iz okee?"

Wilomena nods up and down.

Shleegulz raises an eyebrow.

Wilomena scratches her head.

Shleegulz shrugs.

Wilomena says, "Righto, to th' story then."

The raven screeches almost silently.

Shleegulz mutters something about humans having emotional swings.

Wilomena says, "It's called Th' Girl from Hilldally-Lun."

Wilomena plays a soft, slow melody on her polished mahogany lyre.
  The tune is lively if not perfectly played.

The raven spreads its wings.

Wilomena says, "Gather ye now around th flcikerin' fire, as warm as th mornin sun,"

Wilomena says, "Listen as I tell ye, with help from me lyre, o' the girl from Hilldally-Lun."

Wilomena says, "Against th night so dark and drear th little lass was born,"

The vulture spreads its wings.

Wilomena says, "To a slave mother, drunk with fear, in an ill-bearin field o corn."

Wilomena says, "Th lights from th flamin torches drew closer an closer till dawn,"

The husky drools on the ground.

Wilomena says, "Till against a sky o th palest blue all th slaves strength had been drawn."

Wilomena says, "Th hoof-beats o th slavin train got louder as she wept,"

Wilomena says, "With th last o her strength that did remain, to th base o an alder she crept."

Wilomena says, "In th tattered remains of a slave womans skirt, th child was bundled and placed"

Wilomena says, "Beneath a tall patch o grass in th dirt; against th great alders base."

The raven lets out a streak of loud screeching caws.

Wilomena says, "Th' slavers arrived an th woman did bow at th hooves o' a slavers dark steed,"

Wilomena exclaims, "When asked o her child, she twisted her brow an cried, O, how my poor lass did bleed!"

Wilomena says, "An so th slavers swept her up an galloped back to th slavin town,"

Wilomena says, "Locked her away with no drink an no sup in a cell thirty feet underground."

Wilomena says, "Miles away, neath a great alder tree, a small Flerian lad did discover"

Wilomena says, "A tiny babe cryin out a hungry plea within her torn woolen cover."

Wilomena says, "Th lad held th child gainst his chest an ran off through th' afternoon sun"

Wilomena says, "A few grueling miles to th northwest to a town called Hilldally-Lun."

Wilomena says, "All th town came out of their burrows to see this wool covered baby-girl-joy"

Wilomena says, "Found 'neath th great towerin alder tree by this once quite mischievous boy."

Wilomena says, "Th lad's mother came forth an' unwrapped th' child, starin in shock an' concern,"

Wilomena exclaims, "Th' babe had the ears o' th' elves o' th' wild; said she, "A Flerian's ways she must learn!""

Wilomena says, "An' so neath th' watch o' a Flerian mother, th' small lass began to grow,"

Wilomena exclaims, "An' in three years, she was bigger than brother; an' in fifteen, too big for a burrow!"

Wilomena says, "At last Ma Fler did proclaim to th' girl, "Yer not quite a Flerian at all --"

Wilomena says, "As ye can see from yer plain colored curls an' yer tendency to be very tall.'"

Wilomena asks, "An' so th' girl asked o' her mother so dear, 'What be I then, if not one o' ye?'"

Wilomena says, "Moanin' an' wailin, yer health fadin' fast 'neath th base o' th' tree, in th' dirt.'"

Wilomena says, "An' so th' lass did leave that day, with tears an' a pocket o' gold,"

Wilomena says, "An to th' southeast she did make her way, to th' Great Alder Tree of old."

Wilomena says, "An' neath a fadin evenin sky, the lights o' a city did glow"

Wilomena says, "With spires that reached a hunnerd feet high, an' several mages guardin' below."

Wilomena says, "She spied a small slab, cracked an' misplaced, 'neat th' foundation o' th' high loomin' tower"

Wilomena says, "An so through th' star speckled night she raced, an' hid in th' crack for an hour."

Pollii's stomach growls.

Julien's stomach growls.

The raven eyes you warily.

Wilomena says, "When all was so very quiet within, th' lass walked a little bit deeper,"

The husky barks ominously.
You see Pollii take a bite of her snow white asparagus.

Wilomena says, "An' found herself chilled deep 'neath her skin, as th' passage began to get steeper."

Wilomena says, "She hadn't expected to end up in a jail, neath th' base o' th' great Frontie tower,"

The husky drools on the ground.

Wilomena says, "An' she didn't so much as inhale or exhale, in fear o' confrontin' their power."

Wilomena says, "A guard began to walk th' long block, an' th' lass looked about in true horror,"

Wilomena says, "So she darted inside a cell with no lock, an' th' guard finally exited th' corr'dor."

Wilomena says, "Th' lass then paused to catch her breath, an' was about to leave just how she came,"

Wilomena says, "But a sigh caught her ear 'midst th' rot an' th' death, from a woman with a frail, brittle frame."

The raven lets out a streak of loud screeching caws.

Wilomena says, "Th' woman then turned to meet th' girl's gaze, an' her eyes flickered brighter'n stars --"

Shleegulz blinks.

Wilomena says, "Th' girl saw it too, even among th' thick haze, an' they both reached out through th' bars."

Wilomena says, "Th girl, used th' Flerian knowledge she'd got from her small an' colorful kin,"

The black kitten brings its ears back and twitches its tail.

Wilomena says, "Picked open th' cell that was laden with rot, an' pulled out th' woman within."

The raven screeches almost silently.

The husky scratches behind its ears.

Wilomena says, "Th' woman was weak, but still she did run to th' hole in th' wall th' girl knew,"

The black kitten purrs softly.

Wilomena says, "By th' time they were out, up was comin' th' sun, an' northwesterly they practically flew."

Castin pets the black kitten.

Wilomena says, "Th' girl showed th' woman th' Great Alder Tree; th' place she was stowed as a child,"

Wilomena says, "An' th' woman fell straight to her bruised, brittle knee, an' through her salt tears she smiled."

Wilomena says, "Th' lass bade her rise an follow her quick, an' th' woman did climb to her feet"

Wilomena says, "An' they ran through th' forest, so green an' so thick, till a well traveled trail they did meet."

Wilomena says, "A soft, rollin pasture spread out all around; th' dew glistenin with warm mornin sun,"

Wilomena exclaims, "Th' Flerians came out of their holes in th' ground, cryin, 'Welcome home to Hilldally-Lun!'"

Wilomena plays a harmonius ending on her polished mahogany lyre.

[Gaspar's Grog and Grub.]

Four sturdy walls and a roof of woven branches enclose this small tavern. From the forest floor, winding their way around the trunk of the Mother Tree, a set of intricately railed steps serve as the entrance and exit of the town of Treehaven. Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers.  An ivory inlaid pine bar, a wooden stool, a long weathered wooden bench, a long musty wooden table, some steps circling the tree, some freshly crafted oak steps, an open door, a paper covered posting board, a gilt framed painting on the wall, an open large straw basket, a closed forest green Elindalian book of prayers, a quiver of birch arrows, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a bowl of billy goat gruff gruel, a brown potato, and an empty warm mug of Muldavian coffee are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st vulture (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st raven (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st husky (wearing a small gold collar).
In the room are Marinda the Secian, Tigerlily the Anthian (seated), Zaheela the Leuian (seated), Shaleu the Noble Leuian, Julien the Leuian, Anyah the Human (seated), and Shleegulz the Go-blin-al (seated, a vulture upon his left shoulder).
Obvious exits: None.
